intro: Piper corte-scabrum, commonly known as the rough-skinned pepper plant, is a tropical species belonging to the Piper genus in the family Piperaceae. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, slightly hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that give way to elongated, peppery fruits. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to both ornamental gardens and traditional herbal practices. The plant's name reflects the textured appearance of its foliage and the rough texture of its fruit surface.
